result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert F Schlueter Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Albert F Schlueter Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Albert F Schlueter Jr.  Prosecuting Attorney Kaylan Reilly and Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State asked the Court to take judicial notice of 1991CF914291. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Stachowiak. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense has a copy of the complaint.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.

Defendant Albert F Schlueter Jr not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Plaisted is in trial in another court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Albert F Schlueter Jr appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Albert F Schlueter Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present. On medically leave and vacation, subpoena not received. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Albert F Schlueter Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court pursuant to State v. Lee. No counsel appointed by the Office of the State Public Defender at this time. Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense. Court finds that the defendant is indigent. Court appoints Attorney Plaisted as counsel for defendant. Attorney Plaisted accepts the appointment. Order signed and filed. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing. Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Albert F Schlueter Jr not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  Limited curfew from 5:00pm to 8:00am. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $75,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  Court orders ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DME.

Defendant Albert F Schlueter in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Albert F Schlueter in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Albert F Schlueter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
